#summary The address clear attribute is a deprecated method of clearing certain styles.
#labels about-html,is-html-attribute

You are here: [Welcome Home] > [HTMLReference HTML Reference] > [HTMLElements Elements] > [AddressElement <address> element] > *clear attribute*

== Usage ==

The `clear` attribute negates the effect of the [FloatCSSProperty float] style.  This attribute is deprecated, in favor of using the [ClearCSSProperty clear] CSS property, but browsers still support it.

{{{
<p style="float:left">This text is floated left.</p>
<address clear=left>Copyright &copy; 2007 John Doe</address>
}}}

`none`, `left`, `right`, or `both`.  The default value is `none`.

== Elements ==

You can use the `clear` attribute on the following elements:

  * [AddressElement <address>]
  * [BlockquoteElement <blockquote>]
  * [BrElement <br>]
  * [DdElement <dd>]
  * [DirElement <dir>]
  * [DivElement <div>]
  * [DlElement <dl>]
  * [DtElement <dt>]
  * [HrElement <hr>]
  * [LiElement <li>]
  * [MenuElement <menu>]
  * [OlElement <ol>]
  * [PElement <p>]
  * [PreElement <pre>]
  * [TableElement <table>]
  * [UlElement <ul>]
